java.ui

Class ButtonMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.VBox
              • java.ui.ButtonMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class ButtonMenu
extends javafx.scene.layout.VBox
    ButtonMenu is a class that defines the left side of the Sudoku Board game. It consists of the Note/Answer button, the Clear button, the Pause/Play button, the Show Answer button, and the Send Game button. It also has the Numbers used to enter the corresponding answer or note.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ButtonMenu

        public ButtonMenu()
        A convenience constructor that uses a padding of 10 to create a ButtonMenu.

      • ButtonMenu

        public ButtonMenu(int padding)
        A constructor that creates a ButtonMenu with the given padding. This creates a default button menu, with the Note, Clear, Pause, Show Answer, the Numbers, and the Send Game buttons.
        Parameters:
        padding - An integer that tells how much padding to give.
